condition.description:
Overactive bladder is a condition in which the bladder squeezes urine out at the wrong time. You may have overactive bladder if you have two or more of these symptoms:

  • You urinate eight or more times a day or two or more times at night
  • You have the sudden, strong need to urinate immediately
  • You leak urine after a sudden, strong urge to urinate

You also may have incontinence, a loss of bladder control. Nerve problems, too much fluid, or too much caffeine can cause it. Often the cause is unknown.

Your doctor may prescribe a medicine that can calm muscles and nerves. The medicine may come as a pill, a liquid, or a patch. The medicines can cause your eyes to become dry. They can also cause dry mouth and constipation. To deal with these effects, use eye drops to keep your eyes moist, chew sugarless gum or suck on sugarless hard candy if dry mouth bothers you, and take small sips of water throughout the day.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
condition.name: Overactive bladder

carousel_items: Might cause dry mouth, constipation, drowsiness, dizziness, and blurry vision.
To prevent dry mouth, avoid using mouthwashes with alcohol, chew on sugar-free gum, and take small sips of water as needed.
Can be taken with or without food.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don’t get better in two weeks. There could be other causes of your bladder problems or you may need to try a different medicine.
Can cause drowsiness, so avoid taking with alcohol or other medicines that make you sleepy.

basics.benefits_moa: Oxybutynin is an anticholinergic. It relaxes the bladder muscles by lowering muscle spasms. This helps people go to the bathroom less often and better control their urination.
basics.bottom_line: Oxybutynin is a good treatment for overactive bladder, but watch out for side effects such as dry mouth and constipation.
downsides: Generally not recommended to use in people ages 65 and older since it can cause drowsiness and increase the risk of falls.
Can’t be used if you have uncontrolled narrow-angle glaucoma.
Not recommended if you have ulcerative colitis or certain other stomach problems since Oxybutynin can slow stomach emptying.
Not the best choice if you have GERD (acid reflux), since Oxybutynin can irritate your throat and make the acid reflux worse.
Has more side effects than newer medicines that treat overactive bladder.

downsides_processed.orig: Generally not recommended to use in people ages 65 and older since it can cause drowsiness and increase the risk of falls.
Can’t be used if you have uncontrolled narrow-angle glaucoma.
Not recommended if you have ulcerative colitis or certain other stomach problems since Oxybutynin can slow stomach emptying.
Not the best choice if you have GERD (acid reflux), since Oxybutynin can irritate your throat and make the acid reflux worse.
Has more side effects than newer medicines that treat overactive bladder.

upsides: Oxybutynin is effective at treating overactive bladder by lowering the urge to urinate, and helping to better control urination.
Available in multiple forms: a patch, gel, extended-release tablet, and tablet.
The gel form of Oxybutynin is available over the counter without a prescription.
Oxybutynin patch and gel have fewer side effects than taking the tablet.
The tablet is available as a generic.

upsides_processed.orig: Oxybutynin is effective at treating overactive bladder by lowering the urge to urinate, and helping to better control urination.
Available in multiple forms: a patch, gel, extended-release tablet, and tablet.
The gel form of Oxybutynin is available over the counter without a prescription.
Oxybutynin patch and gel have fewer side effects than taking the tablet.
The tablet is available as a generic.

userStories.tip: It can be sedating so taking it at night is best.

drugs.name: Oxybutynin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Might cause dry mouth, constipation, drowsiness, dizziness, and blurry vision.
To prevent dry mouth, avoid using mouthwashes with alcohol, chew on sugar-free gum, and take small sips of water as needed.
Can be taken with or without food.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don’t get better in two weeks. There could be other causes of your bladder problems or you may need to try a different medicine.
Can cause drowsiness, so avoid taking with alcohol or other medicines that make you sleepy.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat can happen when taking Oxybutynin tablets. Seek medical attention immediately if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat can happen when taking Oxybutynin tablets. Seek medical attention immediately if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Oxybutynin can cause drowsiness, confusion, dizziness, hallucinations, or blurred vision. Avoid driving, operating machinery, or doing anything that requires you to be alert until you know how Oxybutynin affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Oxybutynin can cause drowsiness, confusion, dizziness, hallucinations, or blurred vision. Avoid driving, operating machinery, or doing anything that requires you to be alert until you know how Oxybutynin affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Heat exhaustion
risks_warnings.description: Oxybutynin can make you sweat less, which can make you more prone to heat stroke since your body can’t cool down as well. Make sure to drink plenty of fluids when it’s hot outside, or when you're exercising.

description_processed.orig: Oxybutynin can make you sweat less, which can make you more prone to heat stroke since your body can’t cool down as well. Make sure to drink plenty of fluids when it’s hot outside, or when you're exercising.

carousel_items: Might cause dry mouth, constipation, drowsiness, dizziness, and blurry vision.
To prevent dry mouth, avoid using mouthwashes with alcohol, chew on sugar-free gum, and take small sips of water as needed.
Can be taken with or without food.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don’t get better in two weeks. There could be other causes of your bladder problems or you may need to try a different medicine.
Can cause drowsiness, so avoid taking with alcohol or other medicines that make you sleepy.

basics.benefits_moa: Vesicare is an anticholinergic. It relaxes the bladder muscles by lowering muscle spasms. This helps people go to the bathroom less often and better control their urination.
basics.bottom_line: Vesicare is a good treatment for overactive bladder and doesn’t have as many side effects as similar medications.
downsides: Generally not recommended to use in people ages 65 and older since it can cause drowsiness and increase the risk of falls.
Can’t be used if you have uncontrolled narrow-angle glaucoma.
Not recommended if you have ulcerative colitis or certain other gastrointestinal problems, since Vesicare can slow stomach emptying.
Has some drug interactions, so make sure your doctor has your complete list of medications.

downsides_processed.orig: Generally not recommended to use in people ages 65 and older since it can cause drowsiness and increase the risk of falls.
Can’t be used if you have uncontrolled narrow-angle glaucoma.
Not recommended if you have ulcerative colitis or certain other gastrointestinal problems, since Vesicare can slow stomach emptying.
Has some drug interactions, so make sure your doctor has your complete list of medications.

upsides: Vesicare is effective at treating overactive bladder by lowering the urge to urinate, and helping to better control urination.
Can be taken with or without food.
Causes fewer side effects than other medications in the same drug class.
Only needs to be taken once a day.

upsides_processed.orig: Vesicare is effective at treating overactive bladder by lowering the urge to urinate, and helping to better control urination.
Can be taken with or without food.
Causes fewer side effects than other medications in the same drug class.
Only needs to be taken once a day.

userStories.tip: This is a very expensive drug.

To prevent dry mouth, avoid using mouthwashes with alcohol, chew on sugar-free gum, and take small sips of water as needed.
Can be taken with or without food.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don’t get better in two weeks. There could be other causes of your bladder problems or you may need to try a different medicine.
Can cause drowsiness, so avoid taking with alcohol or other medicines that make you sleepy.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat can happen when taking Vesicare tablets. Seek medical attention immediately if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat can happen when taking Vesicare tablets. Seek medical attention immediately if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Vesicare can cause drowsiness, confusion, dizziness, hallucinations, or blurred vision. Avoid driving, operating machinery, or doing anything that requires you to be alert until you know how Vesicare affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Vesicare can cause drowsiness, confusion, dizziness, hallucinations, or blurred vision. Avoid driving, operating machinery, or doing anything that requires you to be alert until you know how Vesicare affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Heat exhaustion
risks_warnings.description: Vesicare can make you sweat less, which can make you more prone to heat stroke since your body can’t cool down as well. Make sure to drink plenty of fluids when it’s hot outside, or when you're exercising.

description_processed.orig: Vesicare can make you sweat less, which can make you more prone to heat stroke since your body can’t cool down as well. Make sure to drink plenty of fluids when it’s hot outside, or when you're exercising.

risks_warnings.title: Hypersensitivity (allergic) reactions
risks_warnings.description: Some people who take Vesicare get serious allergic reactions to it. If you start to notice difficulty breathing, hives, or swelling after taking Vesicare, seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: Some people who take Vesicare get serious allergic reactions to it. If you start to notice difficulty breathing, hives, or swelling after taking Vesicare, seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Vesicare has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.
risk_factors: Higher dose of Vesicare Taking with other medicines that prolong QT interval (heart problems)

description_processed.orig: Vesicare has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.
